itemDescription: (married name Garrington), (1910–1991), Congregational minister and radio broadcaster

wikipedia_page.main: Elsie Dorothea Chamberlain (3 March 1910 – 10 April 1991) was a British Congregational Church minister and radio broadcaster. She was the first woman minister in the RAF and a leader of the Congregational Federation of churches that formed in 1972.

response: The Federation was formed in 1972 from those Congregational churches which did not enter the union of the Presbyterian Church of England with the Congregational Church in England and Wales to form the United Reformed Church. The leaders at the time were Reginald Cleaves, Margaret, Viscountess Stansgate, John Wilcox and Elsie Chamberlain. Margaret, Viscountess Stansgate became the Federation's first President.
* Elsie Chamberlain studied here before she worked for the BBC and was the "first woman" at several jobs within the church.

link_mentions.page: Christ Church New Southgate & Friern Barnet
response: In 1941 the new minister of the church was Elsie Chamberlain. She would go on to be a leader in the church and to help found the Congregational Federation in 1972.
